intro: Pimpinella ovata, commonly known as the oval cow-wheat, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in umbrella-shaped clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a short life cycle and is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its distribution in suitable habitats.
